intro: Tragia arechavaletae var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and rounded, velvety leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
